Tucson listens to Rodimus, while holding his cab door open for Straight Sho=
t as she and Uproar now help to get Talon out of his cab, and do so careful=
ly.  Quickstride steps in to lift Talon out and holds her gently in his arm=
s.

Tucson now transforms into robot mode. 

"Looks like my time in the CR =
chamber will have to wait.  But Talon should go now."

Quickstride nodds an=
d quickly wisks Talon to the CR chambers.  Tucson turns toward Rodimus.

"B=
oth medics down..  And an Ark in need of repair..  Hmm, I did a good portio=
n of that damage with my sonar system..  First and foremost, are our comrad=
es."

He walks slowly to a door, which leads into the one room he never tho=
ught he'd enter.  His own private workshop.  Before becomming a Prime, he h=
ad taken great pleasure in restorring old weapons and those in desperate ne=
ed of repair.  And in some cases, he would also help to repair damages to o=
ther comrades.  He opens the door with a code.  Straight Shot peeks in.

"W=
ow, it's just as you left it Tucson.  Everything is still there.  Your enti=
re workshop, tools, materials, all neatly categorized according to form and=
 function.  A little dusty in here but still workable space."

Tucson nodds=
.

" True, but things must be kept clean.  And to properly conduct repairs =
on comrades, I'd rather be where they can be monitored safely.  I need some=
 tools, and materials. I can get them here, and bring them to the medical b=
ay."

He turns to Rodimus.

" Inform Ramulus to prepare the med bay for me.=
  It's about time I actually put to work some of the skills I've aquired fr=
om Ratchet and Wheeljack."

Straight Shot looks to Tucson.

" You really sh=
ould have an assistant."

Tucson nodds.

"Yes.  Legacy, if you could, I'd l=
ike you to assist me."

rest as well."

ver stronger. He was

ress, but now, there was
> time to express his feelings for her. He was a b=
ot true to his word. His
> love was real, and it would remain as such.

ery

nly

 I

ir

> Rodimus nodded as the others talked, taking =
his time to look around the
> room, trying to be absolutely sure that nothi=
ng critical is damaged.

> Outside, Hydras and his team were little mo=
re than a dot in the skies as
> they moved away carrying their own injured =
with them. All around the Ark
> defensive shielding began to flicker into p=
lace on the heels of the
> Predacons and Decepticons vacating the area, wea=
pons and guns began to twist
> and turn as they initialized and calibrated =
themselves =96 another Predacon
> attack would not be so easy. In fact this=
 one would not have been if it were
> not for Nightrazor sabotaging many of=
 the Ark's systems and then the sonic
> wave that Tuscon had sent out.
> 
>=
 Even as the main systems were coming up, it would be some time before ever=
y
> systems was running again as they should.
> 
> Legacy near the gigantic=
 forms of Megatron and Optimus, even in death it
> seemed that these two we=
re locked in some sort of titanic struggle. He
> looked around, his single =
optic taking in the entire vista and then he
> turned back to Tuscon and Ro=
dimus.
> 
> "For the moment the time stream would appear undamaged." Legacy=
 pronounced.
> "However it is difficult to know the full ramifications of e=
ven these small
> changes that have occurred, and if we have not inadverten=
tly changed
> something that was."
> 
> Rodimus looked at Legacy, "You're r=
ight." Rodimus came to stand beside
> Legacy, who had himself moved towards=
 Tuscon. "We need to find a way to
> secure this Ark. If it is damaged too =
much, or too many changes are made,
> then all this that we are fighting fo=
r would be for nothing."
> 
> A call came in from Ramulus, "Rodimus, Tuscon=
, our medics are both down. I'm
> holding them together with a med kit, but=
 I am going to need some help down
> here." Ramulus' voice was calm, and ye=
t there was still an edge of something
> in his voice: Concern? Fear? Anger=
?
> 
> From outside Leo II followed by Wing Caliber and the Fuzors. With th=
e battle
> over, they definitely looked tired. Two battles in the space of =
a day would
